p.s: Description of Methylobacterium persicinum sp. nov.
Methylobacterium persicinum (per.si′ci.num. N.L. neut. adj. persicinum peach-coloured, because of its pink colour).
Cells are Gram-negative, motile, ovoid or slightly curved rods (1.2–1.3×2.8–3.9 μm) after 6 days culture on GP agar.
Colonies grown on GP agar for 9 days are circular and smooth with a diameter of approximately 0.5 mm and are light pink in colour.
Growth occurs at 10–35 °C, but not at 4 or 40 °C.
The ability to utilize methanol is weak and utilization occurs at 25–30 °C in the second week of cultivation.
Substrate utilization, enzyme production, acid production and other physiological characteristics are given in Table 1.
The respiratory quinone is ubiquinone Q-10 (100 %).
Major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c (75.8 %), C18 : 0 (14.1 %), C16 : 1ω7c (6.1 %) and C16 : 0 iso (1.3 %).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.1 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
The type strain, 002-165T (=DSM 19562T =NBRC 103628T =NCIMB 14378T), was isolated from a water sample from a food factory in Japan.
